data.title: Fast-refresh color E Ink portable monitor expands screen real estate
data.description: Get the Dasung Paperlike 13K, a 13.3-inch color E Ink monitor with a fast 37 Hz refresh rate. Portable and reduces eye strain. Pre-order yours now.
data.content:
Dasung Paperlike 13K: fast color E Ink portable monitor for reduced eye strain

===============

 April 30, 2025

Fast-refresh color E Ink portable monitor expands screen real estate

![Image 9: Dasung says that the 13K boasts "God Level" refresh at 37 times per second](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/1be83cc/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2892x1481+0+0/resize/2880x1475!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F31%2Fcd%2F6f1c5d58409090ab12a85b7b83df%2F03.jpg)

Dasung says that the 13K boasts "God Level" refresh at 37 times per second

Dasung

![Image 10: Dasung reports that the 13K's color E Ink touchscreen boats 3,200 x 2,400 resolution](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/5757f94/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4032x3024+0+0/resize/2880x2160!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F2a%2Fef%2F6a03548e4517a582af8059e873c2%2F04.jpg)

4/4

Dasung reports that the 13K's color E Ink touchscreen boats 3,200 x 2,400 resolution

Dasung

![Image 11: Scroll for more](https://assets.newatlas.com/b3/0e/8ac097c7401585a3b3f56c44dea0/icon-mouse-scroll-down-outline-solid.svg)

[View gallery - 4 images](https://newatlas.com/mobile-technology/dasung-13k-fast-refresh-color-e-ink-portable-monitor/#gallery:1)

Working all day on a laptop with a backlit display can be very tiring for the eyes, but what if you have more than one screen in front of you? E Ink monitors can help, and the latest from Dasung boasts a fast refresh rate and enhanced color.

We've known that "the world's first 13.3-inch 37-Hz color E Ink monitor" was coming for a while now, after a preview campaign was [launched on Indiegogo](https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/paperlike-13k-world-first-13-3-color-eink-monitor/coming_soon). Bigme recently threatened to get a [30-Hz color E Ink monitor](https://newatlas.com/mobile-technology/bigme-b13-portable-epaper-monitor/?itm_source=newatlas&itm_medium=article-body) of the same size to market before Dasung, but the Paperlike 13K has skipped crowdfunding altogether and gone straight to sale.

More Stories

[![Image 12: Team Group's new SSD can essentially fry its own circuits at the push of a button](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/bcb3eb0/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1200x794+0+3/resize/130x86!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F35%2Fc5%2F517c1bfb4439addf8ca49e8d3eba%2Fteam-groups-new-ssd-can-essentially-fry-its-own-circuits-at-the-push-of-a-button.jpg)](https://newatlas.com/computers/team-group-p250q-ssd-self-destructs/?itm_source=ocelot&itm_medium=recirculation&itm_campaign=ocelot_e079a01&itm_content=recommendation_1)

[![Image 13: Grant Sinclair's GamerCard is priced at Â£125 (about US$168)](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/314d23e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1938x1282+0+5/resize/130x86!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fdf%2F6e%2F602b119f4974a94e7ac33480ad8e%2Fscreenshot-2025-07-14-at-10-59-41-am.jpeg)](https://newatlas.com/games/grant-sinclair-gamercard-handheld-gaming-console/?itm_source=ocelot&itm_medium=recirculation&itm_campaign=ocelot_e079a01&itm_content=recommendation_2)

[Games](https://newatlas.com/games/?itm_source=ocelot&itm_medium=recirculation&itm_campaign=ocelot_e079a01&itm_content=recommendation_2)

[Handheld gaming console takes the form of a pocketable card](https://newatlas.com/games/grant-sinclair-gamercard-handheld-gaming-console/?itm_source=ocelot&itm_medium=recirculation&itm_campaign=ocelot_e079a01&itm_content=recommendation_2)

Until relatively recently, E Ink screens have suffered from pretty poor refresh rates â meaning that watching videos would be a nightmare even if you weren't viewing a horror movie. The ghost of previous images would also haunt the current view post-refresh, prompting the user to intervene manually for clarity.

[![Image 14: The Dasung can duplicate or extend the display real estate of laptops and smartphones in eye-friendly color](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/70413b9/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2146x1258+0+0/resize/1440x844!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F87%2F67%2F3ad33c1a400cbb8967dc0cd46191%2F01.jpg)](https://newatlas.com/mobile-technology/dasung-13k-fast-refresh-color-e-ink-portable-monitor/#gallery:2)

The Dasung can duplicate or extend the display real estate of laptops and smartphones in eye-friendly color

Dasung

At 37 Hz, Dasung notes that the "God Level" refresh technology of its 13K monitor comes in faster than the frame rates of most movies, and inches ever closer to the capabilities of LCD/LED displays. This adds up to smoother transitions and the potential for video playback without stutter.

The exact flavor of E Ink here hasn't been revealed, but Dasung has thrown in a color enhancement algorithm for "true-to-life color reproduction" at a claimed 300 pixels-per-inch density and 3,200 x 2,400 resolution. There's also an auto-clear function to take care of that nasty ghosting problem. An adjustable front light caters for extended use when daylight begins to fade.

[![Image 15: Dasung reports that the 13K's color E Ink touchscreen boats 3,200 x 2,400 resolution](https://assets.newatlas.com/dims4/default/41d006c/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4032x3024+0+0/resize/1280x960!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewatlas-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F2a%2Fef%2F6a03548e4517a582af8059e873c2%2F04.jpg)](https://newatlas.com/mobile-technology/dasung-13k-fast-refresh-color-e-ink-portable-monitor/#gallery:4)

Dasung reports that the 13K's color E Ink touchscreen boats 3,200 x 2,400 resolution

Dasung

Touch interaction is possible, plus there are physical control buttons to the side for menu and function access. The monitor can connect to a source device over USB-C or mini-HDMI, and can duplicate or extend the display of Windows and Linux/Android devices â macOS and iOS systems have proven problematic thus far, so Dasung advises against using the 13K for Apple products. The monitor also sports a DC power port, 3.5-mm headphone jack and mono speaker.

The Paperlike 13K is up for pre-order now at US$749, including cables, a magnetic cover and a portable "stick" stand. Shipping is expected to start from mid-May. A non-touch, grayscale E Ink version without front lighting is also available for $679. And if 37 Hz is just not fast enough, Dasung also sells a [10.3-inch portable monitor](https://newatlas.com/mobile-technology/dasung-paperlike-103-60hz-eink-monitor/?itm_source=newatlas&itm_medium=article-body) that refreshes at 60 Hz. The video below has more.

DASUNG Paperlike 13K : The World's First 13.3-inch 37Hz Color E-ink Monitor

Product page: [Dasung Paperlike 13K](https://shop.dasung.com/products/dasung-paperlike-13k-the-worlds-first-37hz-color-e-ink-monitor)

metadata.description: Get the Dasung Paperlike 13K, a 13.3-inch color E Ink monitor with a fast 37 Hz refresh rate. Portable and reduces eye strain. Pre-order yours now.
metadata.keywords: Dasung Paperlike 13K, color E Ink monitor, portable monitor, E Ink display, fast refresh E Ink, monitor for eye strain, 13.3 inch monitor, color E Ink portable monitor, high resolution monitor, portable E Ink monitor for laptops, second monitor portable, screen for reading, 37hz refresh rate monitor, Dasung monitor, color E Ink screen
metadata.og:title: Fast-refresh color E Ink portable monitor expands screen real estate
metadata.og:image:alt: Dasung has developed "the world's first 13.3-inch 37-Hz color E Ink monitor"
metadata.og:description: Working all day on a laptop with a backlit display can be very tiring for the eyes, but what if you have more than one screen in front of you? E Ink monitors can help, and the latest from Dasung boasts a fast refresh rate and enhanced color.
metadata.article:author: https://newatlas.com/author/paul-ridden/
metadata.twitter:description: Working all day on a laptop with a backlit display can be very tiring for the eyes, but what if you have more than one screen in front of you? E Ink monitors can help, and the latest from Dasung boasts a fast refresh rate and enhanced color.
metadata.twitter:image:alt: Dasung has developed "the world's first 13.3-inch 37-Hz color E Ink monitor"
metadata.twitter:title: Fast-refresh color E Ink portable monitor expands screen real estate
